title: NYPD officer is arrested after 'pointing his gun at a waitress' head at a Queens karaoke bar'
text:
Two NYPD officers have been suspended after one of the men allegedly flashed their gun to staff at a karaoke bar in Queens and then held the barrel to a waitress’ head, a source told DailyMail.com.

The officer allegedly responsible, Hyun Kim, 25, was arrested and charged with two counts of menacing in the incident that unfolded on Tuesday night at the Sagwa Namoo Korean karaoke bar on Depot Road, Flushing.

Hyun Kim went out to the bar with his Sergeant, Jung Kim, after getting off work from the 115 Precinct in Jackson Heights.

At one stage in the night, Hyun Kim is said to have had his gun showing while inside the bar, prompting one waitress to ask him ‘if he’s a gangster’, a source told DailyMail.com.

The officer allegedly responsible, Hyun Kim, 25, was arrested and charged with two counts of menacing in the incident that unfolded on Tuesday night at the Sagwa Namoo (above) Korean karaoke bar on Depot Road, Flushing

The officer allegedly responded to the woman by telling her, ‘No! I’m a cop and I’m with my sergeant.’

To substantiate his claim, Hyun Kim allegedly pulled out the gun and began showing it to the woman in one of the rooms, racking the gun’s slide.

The motion prompted bullets to scatter onto the ground along with the magazine, the source said.

It’s claimed the officer later asked the same waitress to ‘come over to hang with him’, threatening to shoot her if she declined the invitation.

As the woman hastily left the room, Hyun Kim is said to have pointed the firearm at her.

When the owner came into the room to investigate the commotion, Hyun Kim reportedly pointed the gun at another waitress’ head.

Hyun Kim went out to the bar with his Sergeant, Jung Kim, after getting off work from the 115 Precinct in Jackson Heights (above). Hyun Kim allegedly pulled out the gun and began showing it to the woman in one of the rooms, racking the gun’s slide. It’s claimed the same officer later asked the same waitress to ‘come over to hang with him’, threatening to shoot her if she declined the invitation.

Both officers, who are believed to have been drinking at the time, became ensnared in an argument with the owner before walking out, leaving their bullets and magazine behind.

Shortly afterwards, police were called after workers at the bar dialed 911 and said they believed the two men were impersonating police officers.

Investigators came down to the bar and interviewed staff at great length. They also recovered surveillance footage from inside the rooms, and recovered the magazine and bullets from the ground.

Both of the officers were suspended at 3:30pm on Saturday, following Hyun Kim’s arrest. They have been relieved of their duties without pay until further notice, pending the outcome of the District Attorney’s investigation.

The Queens District Attorney’s Office have now launched an investigation into the incident, a spokesperson for the NYPD told DailyMail.com.

A spokesperson for the District Attorney’s Office couldn’t be reached for comment.
